name: NPR
text:
A Homeland Security official has filed a whistleblower complaint saying the head of DHS instructed him to stop reporting on the Russian threat to the U.S. election because it "made President Trump look bad."
 https://t.co/jMGgXCFWYC

name: NPR
text:
In February, President Trump acknowledged the severity of the novel coronavirus to journalist Bob Woodward ‚Äî saying it's "more deadly than even your strenuous flus."

Speaking on Fox News the following month, Trump likened COVID-19 to the seasonal flu.
https://t.co/ppo0sD6rQG

name: NPR
text: Young voters may be poised for a big turnout in 2020. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, how Gen Z ‚Äî those born in or after 1996 ‚Äî are thinking about presidential candidates and today's major political parties. https://t.co/GD6RLHBOfZ

name: NPR
text:
Scientists and engineers in California are building a unique 3.2 billion-pixel camera for a telescope under construction in Chile.

The camera has already taken its first test pictures ‚Äî of some Romanesco broccoli.
https://t.co/7km2Chd1EF

name: NPR
text:
Wildfires are burning from Washington state to Southern California.

Blazes have prompted thousands of people to flee parts of Oregon and caused power outages in California ‚Äî where fires have already burned a record of over 2.3 million acres this year. 
https://t.co/KOk8nT5vg4
